photo.description: The Leaning Tower of Pisa or simply The Tower of Pisa (La Torre di Pisa) is the campanile, or freestanding bell tower, of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa. It is situated behind the Cathedral and it is the third structure by time in Pisa's Piazza del Duomo (Cathedral Square). (Wikipedia)
photo.tags: europe italy pisa leaningtower piazzadelduomo latorredipisa campanile architecture travel sony f717
photo.title: Leaning Tower of Pisa

photo.description: The Leaning Tower of Pisa (Italian: Torre pendente di Pisa) or simply the Tower of Pisa (Torre di Pisa) is the campanile, or freestanding bell tower, of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa. It is situated behind the Cathedral and is the third oldest structure in Pisa's Cathedral Square (Piazza del Duomo) after the Cathedral and the Baptistry.

photo.title: Leaning Tower of Pisa

photo.description: The Leaning Tower of Pisa, Tuscany, Italy The construction of this imposing mass was started in the year 1174 by Bonanno Pisano. When the tower had reached its third storey the works ceased because it had started sinking into the ground. The tower remained thus for 90 years. It was completed by Giovanni di Simone, Tommano Simone (son of Andreo Pisano), crowned the tower with the belfry at half of 14th century.
photo.title: The Leaning Tower of Pisa, Tuscany, Italy

photo.description: Another HDR of the Leaning tower of Pisa, and the Duomo ( Cathedral) next door. This one I actually used a TRIPOD! I know, weird for me! but I had been using my 1000mm lens to take some shots of the details, so I chucked on the wide lens for an HDR. The cloud was great this day, and the Sun was very bright. View On Black View my stream LARGE on DARKR it is worth it. See where this picture was taken. [?]

photo.description: Schaalmodel van de Scheve Toren en de weerspiegeling van de echte toren in een etelageruit in Pisa (Toscane, Italië) Scale-model of the Leaning Tower and the reflection of the real one in a shop-window in Pisa (Tuscany, Italy) This photo comes from the website www.belpaese.nl. Belpaese.nl is a website about Italy. For further information about this picture and a lot of other photographs of Italy and other European countries, please visit this page: belpaese photos
photo.title: Scale-model of the Leaning Tower (Pisa) - 800076

photo.description: The Tower of Pisa is the bell tower of the Cathedral. Its construction began in the august of 1173 and continued (with two long interruptions) for about two hundred years, in full fidelity to the original project, whose architect is still uncertain. In the past it was widely believed that the inclination of the Tower was part of the project ever since its beginning, but now we know that it is not so. The Tower was designed to be "vertical" (and even if it did not lean it would still be one of the most remarkable bell towers in Europe), and started to incline during its construction. Both because of its inclination, and its beauty, from 1173 up to the present the Tower has been the object of very special attention. During its construction efforts were made to halt the incipient inclination through the use of special construction devices; later colums and other damaged parts were substituted in more than one occasion; today, interventions are being carried out within the sub-soil in order to significantly reduce the inclination and to make sure that Tower will have a long life. In all this story it is possible to find a meaningful constant, the "genetic code" of the Tower: its continual interaction with the soil on which it was built. Today's (1999) works for the safeguard and the conservation of the Tower with very advanced methodologies are designed to fully respect this constant.

photo.title: Leaning Tower of Pisa

photo.description: Fact fans - the tower was not all built at once, it was built in 3 stages over nearly two centuries. It was built to a certain height in the first stage and after many years it began to lean, and so when they came back much later to build the second stage they built it upright (at the time) by making one side of each floor higher than the other to compensate for the lean. Ditto for the 3rd stage. So not only does the tower lean as a whole, it is not actually straight in and of itself and so it would never be possible to get it to look like a normal building.

photo.description: The Piazza del Duomo (Cathedral Square) is a wide, walled area at the heart of the city of Pisa, Tuscany, Italy, recognized as one of the main centers for medieval art in the world. Partly paved and partly grassed, it is dominated by four great religious edifices: the Duomo (cathedral), the Campanile (the cathedral's free standing (leaning) bell tower), the Baptistry and the Camposanto.

photo.description: We arrived in Pisa the first day and of course we had to see the leaning tower. It was under some construction but you could climb it any way and we did that in the evening. We luckily didn't need to queue. The visit lasts about 30 minutes. The stairs was... leaning... it felt a bit strange :).

photo.description: In September of 2012 I traveled to spend 2 weeks with a friend in Italy. We had the opportunity to travel to many destinations, including Florence and Rome. All pictures were taken with a 6mp Canon Digital Rebel. After a long day (or two) of flying, I landed in Pisa and met my internet friend Elisa for the first time. As tired as I was, I had to go see the cathedral and its famous leaning tower. You could buy tickets and hike all the way to the top. Given I was jet-lagged and about to keel over, we opted for tickets into the Cathedral instead.

photo.description: While back from tuscany we didn't want to stop for lunch at Autogrill so we just bought some sandwiches at the local bakery and ate them in front of the Leaning tower of Pisa Kids love the tower, because it leans... It was about 15 years I didn't go there... I was so very surprised... everything is so white now and under the sun it was almost difficult to watch it all. The story of the construction is not well known but as an architect I like to imagine this: there was the mayor of Pisa that wanted a tower higher than the others. He called the LA (Local Architect) and told him to build this tower bell.... the architect knew that the soil was not good there and tried to tell to the mayor. The mayor got mad "Are you telling me you are not able to do it? Are you telling me I'm paying a wimp?"... The architect had a family... probably three or four young kids...so told to the mayor "Well... of course I can do it! I was just trying to tell you the "might" eventually perhaps be some small problems..." and the construction begun. Since the first florr was clear that the tower was leaning... but still the mayor was saying "No... it is not leaning... stop to drink all that wione and you will se the tower is straight!!!!". Arrived at the third floor the problem was undeniable. At that time there was the death penalty for architects whose building collapsed so one night our architect sadly packed all his things, wife and children and took to flight before the collapse of the tower ... that's why we do not know anything about him nowadays. The mayor was very angry and started to look for another architect to finish the tower but couldn't. He was walking the town asking for an architect but they all disappeared apart one that told the mayor he just become a snake eater. then it strated the war and the mayor had to spend his money in another way. The years passed and another mayor wanted to finish the tower... there was an architect climber whi wanted to be rich and famous... he went to the mayor and told him he was perfectly able to finish the tower but wanted a lot of money and also a signed document that he would have been free in case of collapse: he got both the things and ... that's the story... I wish you this week not to collapse though leaning: have a wonderful week!!!
photo.tags: tuscany toscana pisa leaningtower torre tower torrependente piazzadeimiracoli
photo.title: Piazza dei Miracoli and leaning tower of Pisa

The mayor was very angry and started to look for another architect to finish the tower but couldn't. He was walking the town asking for an architect but they all disappeared apart one that told the mayor he just become a snake eater. then it strated the war and the mayor had to spend his money in another way. The years passed and another mayor wanted to finish the tower... there was an architect climber whi wanted to be rich and famous... he went to the mayor and told him he was perfectly able to finish the tower but wanted a lot of money and also a signed document that he would have been free in case of collapse: he got both the things and ... that's the story... I wish you this week not to collapse though leaning: have a wonderful week!!!
photo.tags: tuscany toscana pisa leaningtower torre tower torrependente piazzadeimiracoli
photo.title: Piazza dei Miracoli and leaning tower of Pisa

photo.description: While back from tuscany we didn't want to stop for lunch at Autogrill so we just bought some sandwiches at the local bakery and ate them in front of the Leaning tower of Pisa Kids love the tower, because it leans... It was about 15 years I didn't go there... I was so very surprised... everything is so white now and under the sun it was almost difficult to watch it all. The story of the construction is not well known but as an architect I like to imagine this: there was the mayor of Pisa that wanted a tower higher than the others. He called the LA (Local Architect) and told him to build this tower bell.... the architect knew that the soil was not good there and tried to tell to the mayor. The mayor got mad "Are you telling me you are not able to do it? Are you telling me I'm paying a wimp?"... The architect had a family... probably three or four young kids...so told to the mayor "Well... of course I can do it! I was just trying to tell you the "might" eventually perhaps be some small problems..." and the construction begun. Since the first florr was clear that the tower was leaning... but still the mayor was saying "No... it is not leaning... stop to drink all that wione and you will se the tower is straight!!!!". Arrived at the third floor the problem was undeniable. At that time there was the death penalty for architects whose building collapsed so one night our architect sadly packed all his things, wife and children and took to flight before the collapse of the tower ... that's why we do not know anything about him nowadays. The mayor was very angry and started to look for another architect to finish the tower but couldn't. He was walking the town asking for an architect but they all disappeared apart one that told the mayor he just become a snake eater. then it strated the war and the mayor had to spend his money in another way. The years passed and another mayor wanted to finish the tower... there was an architect climber whi wanted to be rich and famous... he went to the mayor and told him he was perfectly able to finish the tower but wanted a lot of money and also a signed document that he would have been free in case of collapse: he got both the things and ... that's the story... I wish you this week not to collapse though leaning: have a wonderful week!!!

At that time there was the death penalty for architects whose building collapsed so one night our architect sadly packed all his things, wife and children and took to flight before the collapse of the tower ... that's why we do not know anything about him nowadays. The mayor was very angry and started to look for another architect to finish the tower but couldn't. He was walking the town asking for an architect but they all disappeared apart one that told the mayor he just become a snake eater. then it strated the war and the mayor had to spend his money in another way. The years passed and another mayor wanted to finish the tower... there was an architect climber whi wanted to be rich and famous... he went to the mayor and told him he was perfectly able to finish the tower but wanted a lot of money and also a signed document that he would have been free in case of collapse: he got both the things and ... that's the story... I wish you this week not to collapse though leaning: have a wonderful week!!!
photo.tags: tuscany toscana pisa leaningtower torre tower torrependente piazzadeimiracoli
photo.title: Piazza dei Miracoli and leaning tower of Pisa

photo.description: While back from tuscany we didn't want to stop for lunch at Autogrill so we just bought some sandwiches at the local bakery and ate them in front of the Leaning tower of Pisa Kids love the tower, because it leans... It was about 15 years I didn't go there... I was so very surprised... everything is so white now and under the sun it was almost difficult to watch it all. The story of the construction is not well known but as an architect I like to imagine this: there was the mayor of Pisa that wanted a tower higher than the others. He called the LA (Local Architect) and told him to build this tower bell.... the architect knew that the soil was not good there and tried to tell to the mayor. The mayor got mad "Are you telling me you are not able to do it? Are you telling me I'm paying a wimp?"... The architect had a family... probably three or four young kids...so told to the mayor "Well... of course I can do it! I was just trying to tell you the "might" eventually perhaps be some small problems..." and the construction begun. Since the first florr was clear that the tower was leaning... but still the mayor was saying "No... it is not leaning... stop to drink all that wione and you will se the tower is straight!!!!". Arrived at the third floor the problem was undeniable. At that time there was the death penalty for architects whose building collapsed so one night our architect sadly packed all his things, wife and children and took to flight before the collapse of the tower ... that's why we do not know anything about him nowadays. The mayor was very angry and started to look for another architect to finish the tower but couldn't. He was walking the town asking for an architect but they all disappeared apart one that told the mayor he just become a snake eater. then it strated the war and the mayor had to spend his money in another way. The years passed and another mayor wanted to finish the tower... there was an architect climber whi wanted to be rich and famous... he went to the mayor and told him he was perfectly able to finish the tower but wanted a lot of money and also a signed document that he would have been free in case of collapse: he got both the things and ... that's the story... I wish you this week not to collapse though leaning: have a wonderful week!!!

photo.description: Leaning Tower of Pisa
photo.title: Leaning Tower of Pisa

photo.description: Leaning tower of Pisa
photo.title: Leaning tower of Pisa

photo.description: From Wikipedia: The Leaning Tower of Pisa (Italian: Torre pendente di Pisa) or simply The Tower of Pisa (La Torre di Pisa) is the campanile, or freestanding bell tower, of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa. It is situated behind the Cathedral and it is the third structure by time in Pisa's Piazza del Duomo (Cathedral Square). Although intended to stand vertically, the tower began leaning to the southeast soon after the onset of construction in 1173 due to a poorly laid foundation and loose substrate that has allowed the foundation to shift direction. The height of the tower is 55.86 m (183.27 ft) from the ground on the lowest side and 56.70 m (186.02 ft) on the highest side. The width of the walls at the base is 4.09 m (13.42 ft) and at the top 2.48 m (8.14 ft). Its weight is estimated at 14,500 tonnes. The tower has 296 steps (the seventh floor has a different number of steps on the two sides, if you climb it on the north part you can count only 294 steps). The tower leans at an angle of 3.97 degrees. This means that the top of the tower is 3.9 meters from where it would stand if the tower were perfectly vertical. View On Black Back to Italy - Visit the World
photo.tags: italia italy toscana tuscany pisa leaningtowerofpisa leaningtower leaning towerofpisa torrependentedipisa torrependente torre torredipisa pisacathedral campanile bell belltower unesco travel europe canon sd450 canonsd450 diamondclassphotographer flickrdiamond
photo.title: The Famous Leaning Tower of Pisa

photo.description: This is one of those super touristy pictures, but I had to see the tower and i had to take a picture of it.. Check!
photo.title: The leaning tower of Pisa

photo.description: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is the campanile, or freestanding bell tower, of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa. It is situated behind the cathedral and is the third oldest structure in Pisa's Piazza del Duomo (Cathedral Square) after the cathedral and the baptistry. The Tower of Pisa was a work of art, performed in three stages over a period of about 177 years. Construction of the campanile began on August 9, 1173, a period of military success and prosperity. The first floor is surrounded by pillars with classical capitals, leaning against blind arches in white marble. The tower began to sink after construction progressed to the third floor in 1178. This was due to a mere three-meter foundation, set in weak, unstable subsoil. Construction was subsequently halted for almost a century, because the Pisans were almost continually engaged in battles with Genoa, Lucca and Florence. This allowed time for the underlying soil to settle. Otherwise, the tower would almost certainly have toppled. The seventh floor was completed in 1319. The bell-chamber was not finally added until 1372.

photo.description: The worldwide known symbol of Pisa : his famous Leaning Tower. It was built in 1173 and started to lean just after his construction due to a poor foundation. It also one of first picture i took with my previous digital camera. La tour de pise : le symbole de la ville Toscane de Pise en Italie. C'est un campanile ou beffroi destine a recevoir les cloches de la cathedrale. Elle a commence a penche peu apres sa construction en 1173.
